moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 d6 4. Bxc6+ b: As black, I did not like my pawn structure. But it is not too bad...
moves.8. Qd3 g6 9. O-O Bg7: Since white seizes center, black tries to develop his bishop by 9. ... Bg7
moves.10. a4 Ne7 11. Bg5 O-O 12. Bxe7: White plays aggressive. He almost always trade pieces when available. But it can cause him to loose positional advantage.
moves.12... Qxe7 13. Rae1 Rab8 14. b3 f5 15. N: Black want to get rid of white's pawn on e4.
moves.15... fxe4 16. Ndxe4 Rbe8: Two major pieces, queen and rook, tries to dominate e rank. White and black both can make tactical moves such as discovered attack.
moves.17. Nb5 Bf5 18. Nexd6: I did make benefits by 18. ... Qxe1. Is there any way for white to prevent it?
moves.18... Qxe1 19. Rxe1: This was painful move for white. I think 19. Nxe8 or 19. Qd5+ would be much better.
